meanings.definition: To suppose that something is the case on the basis of probability or evidence.
meanings.sent1: Presuming the weather forecast is accurate, we can plan our picnic for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She is presuming that her package will arrive by noon.
meanings.sent3: Presuming the cat can cook dinner, we might end up with a burnt meal.
meanings.sent4: The detective was presuming the suspect's guilt based on flimsy evidence.
meanings.sent5: Presuming the bridge can hold our weight, we cautiously crossed to the other side.

meanings.definition: To act or behave in a way that shows one believes they are better or more deserving than others.
meanings.sent1: Stop presuming you are the only one who can solve this problem.
meanings.sent2: He was presuming his promotion before it was even announced.
meanings.sent3: Presuming you are the king of the playground won't make you any friends.
meanings.sent4: She was presuming herself to be the star of the show, ignoring the rest of the cast.
meanings.sent5: Presuming you are the fastest runner, you challenged everyone to a race.
